name: monoecious
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a plant or invertebrate animal) having both male and female organs: Junipers can be either monoecious or dioecious. Earthworms are monoecious, meaning that both female and male organs are present within the same worm. Compare
dioecious
More examplesFewer examplesZucchini are monoecious, which means they have both male and female flowers on the same plant.This species is monoecious and wind-pollinated with slow to moderate growth.Most flatworm species are monoecious, and fertilization is typically internal.These evergreens with needle-like and/or scale-like leaves can be either monoecious or dioecious.
